name: Slime.Engine

types.name: Engine
types.comment:
The Engine type is used as the first argument of applySystems and applyListeners.

With the engine, update functions can be massively simplified, in a true ECS fashion.

types.name: Listener
types.comment:
A Listener constructed in a similar way to Systems with a different purpose:
accepting messages through TEA. It has the same options as System, except Time.

types.name: System
types.comment:
A System constructed in this way will be used by Engine to update the world
with control over side effects (deleting entities and sending commands).

Each of the types has a different function signature for different options:
 * Time: Accepts deltaTime as its first argument.
 * Commands: The return value includes messages. The extra value is included as part of a tuple.
 * Deletes: The return value includes EntityIDs which should be deleted. The extra value is included as part of a tuple.

There is also a Basic, which has no options.

values.name: applyListeners
values.comment:
Useful if you write your own update method. Uses listeners as defined in the
provided engine.
values.type: Slime.Engine.Engine world msg -> world -> msg -> ( world, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: applySystems
values.comment:
Useful if you write your own update method. Uses systems as defined in the
provided engine.
values.type: Slime.Engine.Engine world msg -> world -> Float -> ( world, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: cmds
values.comment: Use in systemWith/listenerWith to define a system or listener with commands.
values.type: ( world, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg ) -> Slime.Engine.SystemStep world msg

values.name: cmdsAndDeletes
values.comment: Use in systemWith/listenerWith to define a system or listener with commands and deletes.
values.type: ( world, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg, List Slime.EntityID ) -> Slime.Engine.SystemStep world msg

values.name: deletes
values.comment: Use in systemWith/listenerWith to define a system or listener with deletes.
values.type: ( world, List Slime.EntityID ) -> Slime.Engine.SystemStep world msg

values.name: engineSubs
values.comment:
Takes the subscriptions for your app and wraps them for the engine. Time messages are provided by the engine.

For use with engineUpdate.

Example:
    Sub.batch [ ... ]
        |> engineSubs
values.type: Platform.Sub.Sub msg -> Platform.Sub.Sub (Slime.Engine.Message msg)

values.name: engineUpdate
values.comment: Wraps up the engine in such a way that you can use it as your entire update function, if desired. Requires use of engineSubs.
values.type: Slime.Engine.Engine world msg -> Slime.Engine.Message msg -> world -> ( world, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Slime.Engine.Message msg) )

values.name: initEngine
values.comment: Initializes an Engine with a deletor, a list of systems, and a list of listeners.
values.type: Slime.EntityDeletor world -> List (Slime.Engine.System world msg) -> List (Slime.Engine.Listener world msg) -> Slime.Engine.Engine world msg

values.name: listener
values.comment: Creates a listener with no options (no commands are created and no deletes).
values.type: (msg -> world -> world) -> Slime.Engine.Listener world msg

values.name: listenerMap
values.comment: Maps a listener of one message type to another.
values.type: (msg -> subMsg) -> (subMsg -> msg) -> Slime.Engine.Listener world subMsg -> Slime.Engine.Listener world msg

values.name: listenerWith
values.comment: Creates a listener with the given options (e.g. cmds, deletes, cmdsAndDeletes)
values.type: { options : stepType -> Slime.Engine.SystemStep world msg } -> (msg -> world -> stepType) -> Slime.Engine.Listener world msg

values.name: noOptions
values.comment: Use in systemWith/listenerWith to define a system or listener with no commands or deletes.
values.type: world -> Slime.Engine.SystemStep world msg

values.name: systemMap
values.comment: Maps a listener of one message type to another.
values.type: (originalMsg -> msg) -> Slime.Engine.System world originalMsg -> Slime.Engine.System world msg

values.name: systemWith
values.comment:
Creates a system with particular timing (timed or untimed) and options (e.g.
cmds, deletes, cmdsAndDeletes).
values.type: { timing : baseSystem -> Float -> world -> stepType , options : stepType -> Slime.Engine.SystemStep world msg } -> baseSystem -> Slime.Engine.System world msg

values.name: timed
values.comment: Use in systemWith to define a timed system.
values.type: (Float -> world -> step) -> Float -> world -> step

values.name: timedSystem
values.comment: Creates a system that accepts deltas, creates no commands or deletes.
values.type: (Float -> world -> world) -> Slime.Engine.System world msg

values.name: untimed
values.comment: Use in systemWith to define an untimed system.
values.type: (world -> step) -> Float -> world -> step

values.name: untimedSystem
values.comment: Creates a system that does not accept deltas, creates no commands or deletes.
values.type: (world -> world) -> Slime.Engine.System world msg

name: Slime
comment:
Experimental

This library provides an easy way to construct entity-component-system style
codeflow in Elm. It achieves this mostly by leveraging currying and getter/setters. For example:

    type alias World =
        EntitySet
            { transforms : ComponentSet Rect
            , balls : ComponentSet Ball
            }

    transforms : ComponentSpec Rect World
    transforms =
        { getter: .transforms,
        , setter: (\comps world -> {world | transforms = comps})
        }


    balls : ComponentSpec Ball World
    balls =
        { getter: .balls,
        , setter: (\comps world -> {world | balls = comps})
        }

    moveBalls : Float -> World -> World
    moveBalls delta =
        -- ...
          stepEntities (entities2 balls transforms) (\ent2 -> { ent2 | b = addVelocity ent2.a ent2.b delta })

stepEntities goes through all the balls (any entity with a ball component and transform component)
in this example and updates their location based on their velocity and the time elapsed.

Because moveBalls' type signature has no concept of the components involved, these systems can easily be
composed to operate in sequence to create an ECS Engine.


# Types

@docs EntityID, EntitySet, ComponentSpec, EntitySpec, ComponentSet, EntityDeletor, Entity, Entity2, Entity3


# Entity specs

@docs componentSpec, entities, entities2, entities3


# Updates and Maps

@docs map, stepEntities, stepEntitiesWith, stepEntitiesAndThen


# Initialization

@docs initComponents, initIdSource


# Deletion

@docs deleteEntity, (&->)


# Retrieval

@docs getEntities, getEntities2, getEntities3, (&.), getEntityByUid, getEntity2ByUid, getEntity3ByUid, getComponentById, getComponent, hasComponent


# Entity management

@docs entityExistsByUid, getUidFromId, getIdFromUid


# Updates

@docs setEntity, setEntity2, setEntity3, forEntityById, forEntityByUid, (&=>), (&~>)


# Creation

@docs spawnEmpty, spawnEntity, spawnEntity2, spawnEntities, spawnEntities2, forNewEntity, forNewEntities

aliases.name: ComponentSet
aliases.comment: Include as a field in your world and initialize with `.initComponents`

aliases.name: ComponentSpec
aliases.comment: A simple {getter, setter} record which is used as a building block for complex functions on `world`
aliases.type: { getter : world -> Slime.ComponentSet a , setter : Slime.ComponentSet a -> world -> world }

aliases.name: Entity3
aliases.type: Slime.Tagged { a : a, b : b, c : c }

aliases.name: EntitySet
aliases.comment: Your world should be an EntitySet. Include an `.idSource` initialized with `initIdSource`

aliases.name: EntitySpec
aliases.type: { getter : world -> List (Slime.Tagged ent) , setter : List (Slime.Tagged ent) -> world -> world }

values.type: Slime.EntityDeletor (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec b (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntityDeletor (Slime.EntitySet world)

values.comment: Convenience notation for retrieving based on an EntitySpec
values.type: world -> Slime.EntitySpec ent world -> List (Slime.Tagged ent)

values.comment:
Sets a particular entity's component. Used with forEntityById and forEntityByUid.
Example:
(_, updatedWorld) =
forEntityById id world
&=> (locations, (0, 0))
&=> (sizes, (2, 6))
values.type: ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, world ) -> ( Slime.ComponentSpec a world, a ) -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, world )

values.comment:
Updates a particular entity's component. Used with forEntityById and forEntityByUid.
(_, updatedWorld) =
forEntityById id world
&=> (locations, moveMe)
&=> (sizes, shrinkMe)
values.type: ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world ) -> ( Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) , Maybe.Maybe a -> Maybe.Maybe a ) -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world )

values.name: componentSpec
values.type: (world -> Slime.ComponentSet a) -> (Slime.ComponentSet a -> world -> world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec a world

values.name: deleteEntity
values.comment:
Use as the start of a deletion block:

    deletor =
        deleteEntity transformSpec
            &-> massSpec
            &-> anotherSpec

The resulting deletor takes an EntityID and a world and clears the world of that Entity.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntityDeletor (Slime.EntitySet world)

values.name: entities
values.comment: Defines an entity spec based on one component. These are all entities which have that component.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.EntitySpec { a : a } world

values.name: entities2
values.comment:
Defines an entity spec based on two components.
These are all entities which have both component.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.ComponentSpec b world -> Slime.EntitySpec { a : a, b : b } world

values.name: entities3
values.comment:
Defines an entity spec based on three components.
These are all entities which have all component.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.ComponentSpec b world -> Slime.ComponentSpec c world -> Slime.EntitySpec { a : a, b : b, c : c } world

values.name: entityExistsByUid
values.type: Slime.EntitySet world -> Slime.EntityID -> Bool

values.name: forEntityById
values.comment: Begin a chain of sets for a particular entity id.
values.type: Slime.EntityID -> world -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, world )

values.name: forEntityByUid
values.comment: Begin a chain of sets for a particular entity id.
values.type: Slime.EntityID -> Slime.EntitySet world -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world )

values.name: forNewEntities
values.comment:
Begins a chain of sets for a certain number of new entities.

    ( _, updatedWorld ) =
        forNewEntities (List.range 0 4)
            world
            (\index spawnPair ->
                spawnPair
                    &=> ( locations, ( index, 0 ) )
            )
values.type: List x -> Slime.EntitySet world -> (x -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world ) -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world )) -> ( List Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world )

values.name: forNewEntity
values.comment:
Begins a chain of sets for a new entity. Useful for complex entity spawning.
Example:

    ( _, updatedWorld ) =
        forNewEntity world
            &=> ( locations, ( 0, 0 ) )
            &=> ( place, ( 2, 6 ) )
values.type: Slime.EntitySet world -> ( Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntitySet world )

values.name: getComponent
values.comment: Simple retrieval from a component set.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSet a -> Slime.EntityID -> Maybe.Maybe a

values.name: getComponentById
values.comment: Try to prefer getEntity(#)ByUid where appropriate. This is useful for filters, however.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.EntityID -> world -> Maybe.Maybe a

values.name: getEntities
values.comment: Simple entity retrieval.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> world -> List (Slime.Entity a)

values.name: getEntities2
values.comment: Simple entity retrieval. An entity is only included if both components provided exist for that entity.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.ComponentSpec b world -> world -> List (Slime.Entity2 a b)

values.name: getEntities3
values.comment: Simple entity retrieval. An entity is only included if all components provided exist for that entity.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.ComponentSpec b world -> Slime.ComponentSpec c world -> world -> List (Slime.Entity3 a b c)

values.name: getEntity2ByUid
values.comment: Returns an entity from a permanent UID.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec b (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> Slime.EntityID -> Maybe.Maybe (Slime.Entity2 (Maybe.Maybe a) (Maybe.Maybe b))

values.name: getEntity3ByUid
values.comment: Returns an entity from a permanent UID.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec b (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec c (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> Slime.EntityID -> Maybe.Maybe (Slime.Entity3 (Maybe.Maybe a) (Maybe.Maybe b) (Maybe.Maybe c))

values.name: getEntityByUid
values.comment: Returns an entity from a permanent UID.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> Slime.EntityID -> Maybe.Maybe (Slime.Entity (Maybe.Maybe a))

values.name: getIdFromUid
values.comment: Retrieves a permanent UID from an entity ID.
values.type: Slime.EntitySet world -> Slime.EntityID -> Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID

values.name: getUidFromId
values.comment: Retrieves an entity ID based on a permanent UID.
values.type: Slime.EntitySet world -> Slime.EntityID -> Maybe.Maybe Slime.EntityID

values.name: hasComponent
values.comment: Filter or helper function to check if a component exists for a given entity
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.Tagged x -> world -> Bool

values.name: initComponents
values.comment: Use to create component sets.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSet a

values.name: initIdSource
values.comment: Use to create an ID source for an EntitySet.
values.type: Slime.IDSource

values.name: map
values.comment: Creates a list of something for each existing component of a given type.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> (a -> b) -> world -> List b

values.name: setEntity
values.comment: Sets the world with an entity's component updated.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.Entity a -> world -> world

values.name: setEntity2
values.comment: Sets the world with an entity's component updated.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.ComponentSpec b world -> Slime.Entity2 a b -> world -> world

values.name: setEntity3
values.comment: Sets the world with an entity's component updated.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a world -> Slime.ComponentSpec b world -> Slime.ComponentSpec c world -> Slime.Entity3 a b c -> world -> world

values.name: spawnEmpty
values.comment:
Spawns an empty Entity. Useful if you just need an Entity ID and want to
set the components manually.
values.type: Slime.EntitySet world -> ( Slime.EntitySet world, Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntityID )

values.name: spawnEntities
values.comment: A convenience method to spawn multiple entities, provided as a list.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> List { a : a } -> ( Slime.EntitySet world , List Slime.EntityID , List Slime.EntityID )

values.name: spawnEntities2
values.comment: A convenience method to spawn multiple entities, provided as a list.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec b (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> List { a : a, b : b } -> ( Slime.EntitySet world , List Slime.EntityID , List Slime.EntityID )

values.name: spawnEntity
values.comment: Spawns an Entity with one component.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> { a : a } -> ( Slime.EntitySet world, Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntityID )

values.name: spawnEntity2
values.comment: Spawns an Entity with two components.
values.type: Slime.ComponentSpec a (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.ComponentSpec b (Slime.EntitySet world) -> Slime.EntitySet world -> { a : a, b : b } -> ( Slime.EntitySet world, Slime.EntityID, Slime.EntityID )

values.name: stepEntities
values.comment: Steps the entities in a world based on the entity spec and update function provided.
values.type: Slime.EntitySpec ent world -> (Slime.Tagged ent -> Slime.Tagged ent) -> world -> world

values.name: stepEntitiesAndThen
values.comment:
Step entities with side effects.

    stepEntitiesAndThen (entities locations) (\entitiy ->
      (entity, \newWorld -> forNewEntity newWorld
          &=> (sparkles, { x = entity.a.x, y = entity.a.y })
          |> Tuple.second
      ))

When there are no side effects in an action, use `identity` for the second value.
values.type: Slime.EntitySpec ent world -> (Slime.Tagged ent -> ( Slime.Tagged ent, world -> world )) -> world -> world

values.name: stepEntitiesWith
values.comment:
Step entities with an extra parameter. Useful for passing through an accumulator
(e.g. a counter or a random number generator).
values.type: Slime.EntitySpec ent world -> (( Slime.Tagged ent, x ) -> ( Slime.Tagged ent, x )) -> ( world, x ) -> ( world, x )
